Posts.EditableText: Ello all, I was just checking up on the progress of my squiffy game because I haven't worked on it in a while and all my data was still there, working fine. But I think it was running slow or something, so I clicked on a notification pop-up asking me to load some scripts from the website, which I did. Now all the data that I've been working on has been wiped and every time I try to edit the game it acts like I'm starting a new one from scratch. I published an unlisted version of the game earlier which still has all the previous data there so is there a way to work off of that or, at least, retrieve my data from this wiped version? Or would I have to use my unlisted version and work from scratch again which is something I really don't want to do since it took a while to get where I was at. Any help would be appreciated, thank you.

Posts.EditableText: Actually, never mind. I read on another discussion that games delete themselves once you save them or something like that so it's fine, I guess. I already started working on a new game save and will use my saved version to help recover any lost work. Just wanted to leave a message so no one else responds or in case someone else has the same issue.
